intro: Pygmaeothamnus, commonly known as the silverleaf thornbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plants are shrubs with silver-gray foliage, which helps reduce water loss in harsh environments. They produce small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pygmaeothamnus species are often used in landscaping due to their hardiness and ornamental value.
